alert.note: Alert for Bexar; Guadalupe; Wilson (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued December 11 at 5:49AM CST until December 11 at 7:00AM CST by NWS Austin-San Antonio
info.description: ...FLASH FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 7 AM CST THIS MORNING FOR EAST CENTRAL BEXAR, SOUTHWESTERN GUADALUPE AND NORTHERN WILSON COUNTIES... At 549 AM CST, Doppler radar and automated rain gauges indicated between 5 and 9 inches of rain have fallen. Flash flooding is already occurring with several low water crossings flooded. While rainfall is ending, it will additional time for water to recede. HAZARD...Life threatening flash flooding. SOURCE...Radar and automated gauges. IMPACT...Life threatening flash flooding of creeks and streams. Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... St. Hedwig, China Grove, New Berlin, and Zuehl. This includes the following streams and drainages... Martinez Creek, Cibolo Creek, Salitrillo Creek, and Women Hollering Creek. FLASH FLOOD...RADAR AND GAUGE INDICATED FLASH FLOOD DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding. Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads. Please report observed flooding to local emergency services or law enforcement and request they pass this information to the National Weather Service when you can do so safely.
